moves.1. e4: Going for my standard opening, alot of mistakes made on both sides, any other views?
moves.2... d6 3. Bb5+: ussually this would be Bc4 but I through in the check to see if I could screw up his pawn structure...
moves.3... c6 4. Bc4: now i realise it might have been a bad move, but it stops the castle queen side with the pawns way forward
moves.4... e6 5. Nc3: I have not seen this formation so I keep to my opening
moves.5... h6 6. a3: didnt want a pin on the knight if he pushed the d pawn, also makes space for the bishop
moves.8... Be7 9. d4: decided to push it further to keep his pawns at bay
moves.10... a5 11. e5: i was trying to open up the game a bit
moves.13... Ba6 14. c3: getting the structure right as i see a closed down game
moves.15... f5 16. g3: trying to stop the pawn pushon f file
moves.16... c5 17. Ba2: ?! have no idee what I was thinking here
moves.17... c4 18. h4: Here i was making space for both nights behind my pawns, trying to stop his pawn push and get some more room
moves.18... Re8 19. Nf4: Here i was still looking at knights to h2 and h3
moves.19... Qb6 20. Ng6: saw there was an outpost for the knight on g6, always dangerous and an iritation to the other playere
moves.20... Bd8 21. Bb1: here i was thinking of getting the bishop more active again as my lines were closed down
moves.21... Nf8 22. h5: defending the knight, i knew the pawn would be harder to defend and if i was black i would take the exchange here
moves.23... Bxh4 24. Nxh4: I did not want to playgxh4, this would open the g file and maybe cause me trouble
moves.24... Nh7 25. f4: Locking down the position and blocking Khg5
moves.25... Ndf8 26. Bc2: thinking of bishop d1 and then plaing it up the board
moves.29... Qf7 30. Rag1: getting the ducks in a row for the push
moves.30... Re7 31. Ke1: trying to get rex out of the way
moves.32... Qe8 33. gxf5: Here i kenw I would pick up some free pawns, i was also eyeing to push the pawn and trade bishop for knight h7....
moves.34... Bxf5 35. Bxf5: exchange, this might have been a bad move, bishops in a semi open game agains knights.....
moves.35... Rf7 36. Bxh7+: So i traded, bad bishop for good knight....
moves.36... Nxh7 37. Qxd5: picking up stranglers, oponent did not see b5 was defended by his queen?
moves.37... Rb8 38. Rg3: trying to het the battering ram started
moves.38... Kh8: think I Kf8 might have been better
moves.39. Rhg1: linning up, thinking Qg2 - but this would mean losing a queen for a rook..... stil looking
moves.40... Nf6 41. Qf3: Well played by him, using the pinned piece
moves.41... Nd5 42. Rg3g4: I was thinking Qg3 with the rooks infront, or after the exchange g1, i was hoping to trade, as this was a bad trade for him, he is down and exchanging a piece that was defending good for a blocked in bishop....
moves.44... Rbb7 45. Qe4: Here I was not sure how to proceed, went on a 3 day boat cruise and when I returned i figured it out
moves.47... Qf8 48. Rg4g6: pushing up the board to defend the f6 hole.... not that it was an immediate threat
moves.49. f6: I had calculated gxf6, Rook g8+, wins
moves.49... Rxe6: He must have seen it too, here i calculated some more and saw i was stil in a good position, and the initial plan was still on even though my queen was pinned to the king...
moves.50. Rg6xg7+: Double check leaves the queen semi safe
moves.50... Kh8 51. Rg7g8+: I saw i could trade 2 rooks for a queen and win his rook with check
moves.53... Rf7: Here i thought about chasing the king around but realised that pushing the d pawn would be more important, my oponent could only play Kf8 to avoid losing his rook
moves.54. d5: Here my oponent retired from the game even though i thought there was still a lot of work to be done to finnish.
